ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English non, from Old English nān ('not one'), equivalent to ne ('not') + ān ('one').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Pronoun: A word that takes the place of a noun.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Not one; not any; no amount or part.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: None of the solutions worked, so we had to start over.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这些解决方案都没有奏效，所以我们不得不重新开始。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Adverb: A word that modifies a verb, adjective, or another adverb.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To no extent; not at all (used to modify an adjective or adverb, often in comparative phrases).
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 毫不；一点也不 (常用于比较级短语中)。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He felt none the worse after staying up all night.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 熬夜一整晚后，他感觉一点也不差。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Adjective: A word that modifies a noun.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: (古语或诗歌用语) 没有的；一点也没有的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: To none evil purpose did he come.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他来不是出于任何邪恶的目的。
